reviewText: The stage was way too large to be enjoyed, even on a large HD tv. Costumes were awesome, singing was superb, as was the stage direction. A very enjoyable operetta.

Great fun, as all Strauss should be. I was surprised I had never heard of this piece. And I liked it, especially the staging- right on the banks of the Grand Canal. It was a bit too much like "Fledermaus" for me, but really that's OK too. I had a very difficult time following the story, or even making any sense of it at all. Still, for a Johann Strauss lover, well worth owning.
